personnalitÃ©.bio_en: Founder of the Movement for the Triumph of Democratic Liberties (MTLD) in 1946, legal successor of the Algerian People's Party (PPA). Messali Hadj was a central figure of Algerian nationalism, demanding full independence.

personnalitÃ©.bio_en: Founding member of the FLN in 1954, Boudiaf helped organize the uprising. He became a political opponent post-independence and returned to lead Algeria briefly in 1992 before being assassinated.

personnalitÃ©.bio_en: Minister of the Interior at the outbreak of the war, Mitterrand refused to call it a war and advocated a firm military response. He sent riot police (CRS) and repressed the FLN movement.

personnalitÃ©.bio_en: Appointed Governor-General of Algeria in 1955, he promoted the integration of Algerian Muslims into the French Republic while conducting a strong military repression against the FLN.
